posts.subject: Millchan Instance Help
posts.body:
To mcdev,
I'm trying to deploy my own Millchan instance. 
When a user posts on my instance, ZeroNet throws an invalid content.json error. 

I have set up the two main content.json files like yours and signed them.  The issue regards the content.json files inside user directories which seem to lack signature data, causing ZeroNet to throw a fit.

Help is appreciated.

Bonus question: how did you set up your own CA for Millchan?

>>487a84f8-18d7-4006-a752-727db0d62b2f
I'm not referring to the file data/users/content.json which appears in the UI and is signed. I'm talking about the content.json files generated when a user posts, i.e. data/users/XXXXXXXXXXXXX/content.json which do not appear in the UI and cannot be signed from there.
>Certs are self-signed.
Inside data/users/content.json there is an entry:
   "millchan": ["1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD"],
How do I set up the equivalent on my instance?

>>09b2a240-0e49-42e6-a5d3-6d7ab08d0ff6
I'm not sure what did it, but after some fiddling I am no longer getting that error about the invalid content.json. So the remaining issues are 
A.) anyone can post with any certificate.
B.) Self-sign certificates aren't generating.
Ideally, all certificates should be invalid except ones generated on my zite.

As for A.), the only permission rule I have is for zchan (the name of my instance) and acceptable_domains in config.ts only lists zchan. So then why can I post using @millchan or @zeroid.bit?

You can have a look at my zite:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BbXtvu7LMNnpuRwEytw1ke1Wk8B1i3DTo/

As for B.), in cert_signers, "zchan": [""] is missing its value.
>I'm assuming you didn't change the "anonWIF" defined in that same file.
No I didn't. I'm not certain what anonWIF is supposed to be. Is it used to sign certificates? If so, does that mean I have to be online all the time for new users to post if I don't allow ZeroID or another CA?

Thanks for your assistance by the way.

>>a5b02341-0be5-4eaa-94f7-21653afad658
>Did you run npm again after changing the config.ts file?
No. I tried that now and I can still post with @millchan as my cert. 
>If you're not going to change that the cert_signers for "zchan" should remain with the "1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD" value
I've inserted that public key into the content.json. When I sign the content.json it reverts to the empty string.

I uploaded my zite if you want to take a look:
https://files.catbox.moe/qk0j0k.tar

>>49811205-8ae8-498e-b4d7-43caed140778
It seems to working fine on my end now. My millchan and zeroID certs are greyed out as they should be.
>Try signing it from the command line using the "siteSign" command as mentioned before.
That worked for me.

One thing I don't understand is why the private key for cert signing is public.

I demonstrated deploying Millchan in my new video on ZeroNet. Hope I did it right. Enjoy!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W2dXFYiPXIE
